entries: Umbrafang makes three tentacle attacks. It can replace one tentacle attack with a single use of Bite.

action.name: Bite
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature {@condition grappled} by Umbrafang, that creature is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside Umbrafang and it takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage at the start of each of Umbrafang's turns. Umbrafang can only have one target swallowed at a time. If Umbrafang dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} and can escape from the corpse using 5 feet of movement.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 8} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage and 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage.
If the target is Large or smaller it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}).
Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and Umbrafang can't use that tentacle on another target.
Umbrafang has 6 tentacles. Each can be used to grapple a different target.

action.name: Toxic Mucus (Out of Water Only, Recharge 5 - 6)
entries: Umbrafang releases globules of sticky mucus from bulbous glands across its body, which scatter out from it in a 10-foot radius sphere. The mucus remains on the ground for 1 minute, or until washed away by 5 or more gallons of fresh water. A creature that starts its turn in the area or moves within the area for the first time on its turn must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained} by the mucus for 1 minute. A {@condition restrained} creature can attempt this saving throw again at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Acidic Spittle {@recharge 5}
entries: Umbrafang vomits up a corrosive spittle in a 5-foot-wide, 30-foot-long line. Creatures caught in the line must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or take 21 ({@damage 6d6}) acid damage.

If a creature who is wearing nonmagical armor fails this saving throw, the armor takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to the AC it offers. Armor reduced to an AC of 10 or a shield that drops to a +0 bonus is destroyed.

If Umbrafang uses this ability while it has a creature swallowed, the creature is vomited up along with the spittle, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) acid damage and landing {@condition prone} at the end of the 30-foot line. If the creature is wearing nonmagical armor, the AC it offers is immediately and permanently reduced by 1. If this would place the vomited creature in a space already occupied by another creature, the occupying creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity throw or be pushed 5 feet and knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, the creature isn't knocked {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: Tentacle Attack
entries: Umbrafang makes a tentacle attack.

legendary.name: Fish's Flurry
entries: Umbrafang moves up to half its movement speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Digestion Glands (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Umbrafang recharges either its Acidic Spittle or Toxic Mucus

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: Umbrafang can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Creature of Legend
entries: Umbrafang is a unique creature of legend. Its weapon attacks are magical, and it has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Freedom of Movement
entries: When in water, Umbrafang ignores difficult terrain, and magical effects can't reduce its speed or cause it to be {@condition restrained}. It can spend 5 feet of movement to escape from nonmagical restraints or being {@condition grappled}.

trait.name: Toxic Aura
entries: At the start of Umbrafang's turns, each creature within 5 feet of it takes 2 ({@damage 1d4}) poison damage.

trait.name: Stagnant Protection
entries: Umbrafang has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks when in stagnant or still water. In addition, when underwater, it has a +2 bonus to its AC against attacks originating from out of or above water.

If the target is a Large or smaller creature {@condition grappled} by Umbrafang, that creature is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside Umbrafang and it takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) acid damage at the start of each of Umbrafang's turns. Umbrafang can only have one target swallowed at a time. If Umbrafang dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} and can escape from the corpse using 5 feet of movement.

On a successful save, the creature isn't knocked {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: Fish's Flurry
entries: Umbrafang moves up to half its movement speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The abyss maw's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). The abyss maw can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

action.name: Amphibious
entries: The abyss maw can breathe air and water.

action.name: Astral Swimmer
entries: When the abyss maw is in a Plane of Existence other than the Material Plane, it has a fly speed equal to its swimming speed.

action.name: Creature of Legend
entries: The abyss maw is a unique creature of legend. Its attacks are magical, and it is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

action.name: Death Throes
entries: If the abyss maw is reduced to 0 hit points, it immediately makes a single melee weapon attack as a reaction.
This attack has advantage, and if it hits, it is an automatic critical hit. After resolving this attack, the abyss maw dies.

action.name: Freedom of Movement
entries: The abyss maw ignores difficult terrain, and magical effects can't reduce its speed or cause it to be {@condition restrained}. It can spend 5 feet of movement to escape from nonmagical restraints or being {@condition grappled}.

action.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries: When the abyss maw fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

Plane-touched Pseudopods. The abyss maw channels its magical ability through 6 pseudopods, which protrude from a fleshy mound in its throat. A pseudopod can be severed by an attack or spell that deals magical slashing damage. Each pseudopod has AC 20 and 30 hit points. When a pseudopod is severed, the abyss maw's spell save DC and attack modifier is reduced by 1. If all pseudopods are severed, any spell the abyss maw attempts to cast immediately fails.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The abyss maw makes two pseudopod attacks, one of which it can replace with one use of Bite.

action.name: Bite
entries: Melee weapon attack: +9 to hit, reach 5ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d10 + 5}) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is also {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}), and the abyss maw can't use its bite on another target.

action.name: Consume
entries: Melee weapon attack: +9 to hit, reach 5ft., one target {@condition grappled} by the abyss maw's Bite. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d10 + 5}) piercing damage, and the target is that creature is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the abyss maw, and it takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the abyss maw's turns.
The abyss maw can only have one target swallowed at a time.

If the abyss maw takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw at the start of its turn or regurgitate the swallowed creature, which falls {@condition prone} in a space within 5 feet of the abyss maw. If a swallowed creature is reduced to 0 hit points, it is disintegrated, along with all items it was carrying, leaving no trace behind. If the abyss maw dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse using 5 feet of movement.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: Melee weapon attack: +9 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is hit by 2 or more pseudopods in the same round and is Large or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the abyss maw can't use those pseudopods on another target.
The abyss maw has 6 pseudopods.

legendary.name: Pseudopod Strike
entries: The abyss maw makes a tentacle attack.

legendary.name: Planar Tendrils (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The abyss maw casts a spell.

legendary.name: Darting Rush
entries: The abyss maw moves up to half its swimming speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Pseudopod Strike
entries: The abyss maw makes a tentacle attack.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The bathyal beholder's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks).
The bathyal beholder can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The bathyal beholder can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Antimagic Cone
entries: The bathyal beholder's central eye creates an area of antimagic, as in the {@spell antimagic field} spell, in a 120-foot cone. At the start of each of its turns, the bathyal beholder decides which way the cone faces and whether the cone is active.
The area works against the bathyal beholder's own eye rays and magic.

trait.name: Creature of Legend
entries: The bathyal beholder is a mythical creature of legend. Its melee weapon attacks are magical, and it has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: When the bathyal beholder fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Bite
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 4d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Eye Rays
entries: The bathyal beholder shoots three of the following magical eye rays at random (reroll duplicates), choosing up to three targets it can see within 120 feet of it:

items.name: 1. Charm Ray.
entries: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by the bathyal beholder for 1 hour, or until the bathyal harms the creature.

items.name: 2. Paralyzing Ray.
entries: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

items.name: 3. Dissection Ray.
entries: The targeted creature must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 36 ({@damage 8d8}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If a creature fails a save against this ray twice in under 1 minute, it loses one random appendage.

items.name: 4. Transmutation Ray.
entries: If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or become polymorphed into a creature or nonmagical object of the bathyal beholder's choice that has a Challenge Rating no higher than 1. The target remains polymorphed this way for 1 hour, until it takes damage, or until a creature reverses the effect with {@spell dispel magic} or a similar spell.

If the target is a Large or smaller nonmagical object that isn't being worn or carried, it is transformed into a different object of similar size. If the target is a Huge or larger object, this ray affects a 10-foot cube of it. This effect lasts until dispelled.

items.name: 5. Drown Ray.
entries: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or begin to suffocate. A suffocating creature can survive for a number of rounds equal to its Constitution modifier (minimum of 1 round). At the start of its next turn, it drops to 0 hit points and is dying, and it can't regain hit points or be stabilized until it can breathe again. The target can attempt the saving throw again at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. This ray has no effect on constructs, or creatures that don't need to breathe.

items.name: 6. Coral Ray.
entries: The targeted creature must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature starts to become covered in coral and is {@condition restrained}. It must make a Strength saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends, and the target breaks free. On a failure, the creature transforms into a coral structure and is {@condition petrified} until freed by the {@spell greater restoration} spell or other magic. If a creature {@condition petrified} in this way is not at least partially submerged in water, it also begins to dry up. After 1 hour of being left out to dry, the {@condition petrified} creature dies.

items.name: 7. Erosion Ray.
entries: If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be cursed. A cursed creature has its hit point maximum reduced by 5 ({@dice 1d10}) every time it takes damage. If this damage reduces the cursed creature to 0 hit points, its body is ground down into a pile of gritty, sand colored bones.

If the target is a Large or smaller nonmagical object or creation of magical force, it is disintegrated without a saving throw. If the target is a Huge or larger object or creation of magical force, this ray disintegrates a 10-foot cube of it.

items.name: 8. Desiccation Ray.
entries: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or take 16 ({@damage 3d10}) necrotic damage and be afflicted with 2 levels of {@condition exhaustion} as all liquid is sucked out of its body. For as long as the creature remains exhausted in this way, it can't regain hit points, and it dies if the ray reduces it to 0 hit points. The ray has no effect on undead or constructs.

The bathyal beholder can take 3 legendary action, using the options below. It can take only one legendary action at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The bathyal beholder regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Eye Ray
entries: The bathyal beholder uses one random eye ray.

legendary.name: Spellcasting
entries: The bathyal beholder casts a spell.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The bathyal beholder's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 20}, {@hit 12} to hit with spell attacks). The bathyal tyrant can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The bathyal tyrant can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Antimagic Cone
entries: The bathyal tyrant's central eye creates an area of antimagic, as in the {@spell antimagic field} spell, in a 150-foot cone. At the start of each of its turns, the bathyal tyrant decides which way the cone faces and whether the cone is active. The area works against the bathyal tyrant's own eye rays and magic.

trait.name: Creature of Legend
entries: The bathyal tyrant is a mythical creature of legend. Its melee weapon attacks are magical, and it has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: When the bathyal tyrant fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Tentacles
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5ft., one creature. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d8 + 4}) piercing damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 18}), and the bathyal tyrant can't use it's tentacles to attack another target.

action.name: Consume Thoughts
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5ft., one creature {@condition grappled} by the bathyal tyrant. {@h}55 ({@damage 10d10}) psychic damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the bathyal tyrant kills the target by desiccating its brain.

action.name: Eye Rays
entries: The bathyal tyrant shoots three of the following magical eye rays at random (reroll duplicates), choosing up to three targets it can see within 150 feet of it:

items.name: 1. Charm Ray.
entries: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by the bathyal beholder for 1 hour, or until the bathyal harms the creature.

items.name: 2. Paralyzing Ray.
entries: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

items.name: 3. Dissection Ray.
entries: The targeted creature must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, 45 ({@damage 10d8}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If a creature fails a save against this ray twice in under 1 minute, it loses one random appendage.

items.name: 4. Transmutation Ray.
entries: If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw or become polymorphed into a creature or nonmagical object of the bathyal tyrant's choice that has a Challenge Rating no higher than 1. The target remains polymorphed this way for 1 hour, until it takes damage, or until a creature reverses the effect with {@spell dispel magic} or a similar spell.

If the target is a Large or smaller nonmagical object that isn't being worn or carried, it is transformed into a different object of similar size. If the target is a Huge or larger object, this ray affects a 10-foot cube of it. This effect lasts until dispelled.

items.name: 5. Drown Ray.
entries: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or begin to suffocate. A suffocating creature can survive for a number of rounds equal to its Constitution modifier (minimum of 1 round). At the start of its next turn, it drops to 0 hit points and is dying, and it can't regain hit points or be stabilized until it can breathe again. The target can attempt the saving throw again at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. This ray has no effect on constructs, or creatures that don't need to breathe.

items.name: 6. Coral Ray.
entries: The targeted creature must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature starts to become covered in coral or other undersea flora and is {@condition restrained}. It must make a Strength saving throw at the end of its next turn.

On a success, the effect ends, and the target breaks free. On a failure, the creature transforms into a coral structure and is {@condition petrified} until freed by the {@spell greater restoration} spell or other magic.

items.name: 7. Erosion Ray.
entries: If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw or take 54 ({@damage 12d8}) force damage.

If this damage reduces the creature to 0 hit points, its body is ground down into a pile of gritty, sand colored bones.  If the target is a Large or smaller nonmagical object or creation of magical force, it is eroded without a saving throw. If the target is a Huge or larger object or creation of magical force, this ray erodes away a 10-foot cube of it.

items.name: 8. Desiccation Ray.
entries: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or take 33 ({@damage 6d10}) necrotic damage and be afflicted with 2 levels of {@condition exhaustion} as all liquid is sucked out of its body. For as long as the creature remains exhausted in this way, it can't regain hit points, and it dies if the ray reduces it to 0 hit points. The ray has no effect on undead or constructs.

legendary.name: Spellcasting
entries: The bathyal tyrant casts a spell.

legendary.name: Tentacle Strike
entries: The bathyal tyrant attacks with its Tentacles.

legendary.name: Eye Ray
entries: The bathyal tyrant uses one eye ray.

action.name: Creature of Legend
entries: Ophelia is an undead creature of legend. She is immune to effects that turn or destroy undead.

action.name: Monstrous Form (1/Short Rest)
entries: As a bonus action, Ophelia can use her unholy magic to transform the crab she possesses, turning it into a huge, scuttling monstrosity to better assail her foes.

This transformation lasts for 1 minute. It ends early if Ophelia is knocked {@condition unconscious}, or chooses to end it as a bonus action on her turn. While transformed, Ophelia has the following additional rules: Her size increases to Huge.
She gains 100 temporary hit points.
She gains a +2 bonus to AC.
Her movement speed increases to 45 feet, and her swimming speed increases to 60 feet.
Her Strength score increases to 22 (+6) She loses her proficiency with Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

action.name: Nimble and Scuttling (Tiny Form Only)
entries: If Ophelia is subjected to an effect that allows her to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, she instead takes no damage if she succeeds, and only half damage if she fails.

action.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: When Ophelia fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Ophelia makes two claw attacks. If in her monstrous form, she can replace one claw attack with one use of monstrous stomp.

action.name: Claw (Tiny Form)
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 ({@damage 1d4 - 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw (Monstrous Form)
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Monstrous Stomp (Monstrous Form Only)
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Life Drain {@recharge 5}
entries: Ophelia targets up to three creatures that she can see within 10 feet of her. Each target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or take 21 ({@damage 6d6}) necrotic damage, and Ophelia regains hit points equal to half the total damage dealt to all targets.

action.name: Create Undead Crew (2/Day)
entries: Ophelia creates 7 ({@dice 2d6}) undead thralls under her control, which appear in unoccupied spaces within 30 feet of her. As a bonus action, Ophelia can mentally command one or more of the thralls, provided they are within 120 feet of her. Once given an order, the thrall continues to follow it until its task is complete. Ophelia can have a maximum of 20 thralls summoned at any time. A thrall remains animated for 8 hours, or until reduced to 0 hit points, at which point they collapse into pieces.

Ophelia's thralls have the same statistics as a zombie, except they have a swim speed of 30 feet, Dexterity score of 14 (+2), can speak Common and Abyssal, and are equipped with a scimitar and a hand crossbow. A thrall can survive without its head and doesn't bleed.

action.name: Nimble and Scuttling (Tiny Form Only)
entries: If Ophelia is subjected to an effect that allows her to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, she instead takes no damage if she succeeds, and only half damage if she fails.

legendary.name: Crush (Monstrous Form Only)
entries: Ophelia makes a claw attack.

legendary.name: Scuttle Away!
entries: (Tiny Form Only). Ophelia moves up to half her movement speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: The Will of Orcus (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Ophelia casts a spell.

legendary.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries: Ophelia's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks).
Ophelia can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: blindness/deafness, ray of enfeeblement
2/day: counterspell, {@spell dispel magic}, spirit guardians
1/day: contagion, blight

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Ophelia's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). Ophelia can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

action.name: Creature of Legend
entries: Ophelia is an undead creature of legend. She is immune to effects that turn or destroy undead.

action.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: When Ophelia fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

This transformation lasts for 1 minute. It ends early if Ophelia is knocked {@condition unconscious}, or chooses to end it as a bonus action on her turn. While transformed, Ophelia has the following additional rules: Her size increases to Huge.
She gains 50 temporary hit points.
She gains a +2 bonus to AC.
Her movement speed increases to 45 feet, and her swimming speed increases to 60 feet.
Her Strength score increases to 18 (+4).
She loses her proficiency with Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

action.name: Claw (Tiny Form)

action.name: Claw (Monstrous Form)
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Monstrous Stomp (Monstrous Form Only)

As a bonus action, Ophelia can mentally command one or more of the thralls, provided they are within 120 feet of her. Once given an order, the thrall continues to follow it until its task is complete. Ophelia can have a maximum of 10 thralls summoned at any time. A thrall remains animated for 8 hours, or until reduced to 0 hit points, at which point they collapse into pieces.

Ophelia's thralls have the same statistics as a zombie, except they have a swim speed of 30 feet, Dexterity score of 14 (+2), can speak Common and Abyssal, and are equipped with a scimitar and a hand crossbow. A thrall can survive without its head, and doesn't bleed. A thrall can survive without its head and doesn't bleed.

entries: Ophelia makes a claw attack.

legendary.name: Scuttle Away!
entries: (Tiny Form Only). Ophelia moves up to half her movement speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

entries: Ophelia casts a spell.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The sea flayer can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Creature of Legend
entries: The sea flayer is a unique creature of legend.

Its attacks are magical and it is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form. In addition, the sea flayer can't be killed unless it is in the Elemental Plane of Water. If the sea flayer is reduced to 0 hit points when in any other Plane of Existence, it is instead banished to the Elemental Plane of Water, where it remains for the next 100 years.

trait.name: Destructive Titan
entries: The sea flayer ignores difficult terrain, and magical effects can't reduce its speed or cause it to be {@condition restrained}.
It can spend 5 feet of movement to escape from nonmagical restraints or being {@condition grappled}, and its attacks deal double damage to structures and Gargantuan vehicles.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: When the sea flayer fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Protective Swarm
entries: The sea flayer is protected by a colossal swarm of tiny mind flayer tadpoles, which assail any creatures that venture too close to it. At the start of each of the sea flayer's turns, each creature or vehicle within 20 feet of it takes 10 ({@dice 3d6}) nonmagical piercing damage from the swarm's bites.
If the sea flayer takes fire damage, the swarm disperses and this trait ceases to function until the start of the sea flayer's following turn.

trait.name: Crushing Tentacles
entries: The sea flayer has six Gargantuan tentacles it uses to crush its foes. These tentacles can be attacked and damaged individually, and are treated as separate allied creatures by area effects. A tentacle automatically fails any saving throw such an effect subjects it to. Each tentacle has AC 20 and 50 hit points. When a tentacle is reduced to 0 hit points, it falls away from the main body of the sea flayer. Any creatures adjacent to a tentacle when this happens must succeed on a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw or take 39 ({@damage 6d12}) bludgeoning damage. Creatures who fail this saving throw while standing on a solid surface are also {@condition restrained} by the severed tentacle until they use an action to free themselves.
When a tentacle is reduced to 0 hit points, the sea flayer can't use that tentacle again until it has been regenerated.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The sea flayer can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes one attack with each of its tentacles. It can replace one tentacle attack with a Colossal Bite.

action.name: Tentacles
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 13} to hit, reach 50 ft., one target.  {@h}17 ({@damage 3d6 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Colossal Bite
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d8 + 7}) piercing damage.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the sea flayers choice within 120 feet of it and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the sea flayer is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the sea flayers Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Conjure Mind Flayer Guardians {@recharge}
entries: The sea flayer summons {@dice 1d3} mind flayer allies from within its secondary stomach, which appear within 10 feet of it. The mind flayers can breathe air and water, have a swimming speed of 40 feet, and 30 hit points. The sea flayer can't have more than 3 mind flayer allies summoned in this way at any one time.

action.name: Mind Blast {@recharge 5}
entries: The sea flayer magically emits a burst of psychic energy out from it in a 20-foot radius sphere. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 19} Intelligence saving throw or take 36 ({@damage 8d8}) psychic damage and be {@condition stunned} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

legendary.name: Tentacle Attack
entries: The sea flayer makes a tentacle attack.

legendary.name: Call for Aid (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The sea flayer recharges its Conjure Mind Flayer Guardians action.

legendary.name: Regenerate (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The sea flayer regenerates one tentacle, or regains 10 hit points.

entries: The sea flayer can breathe air and water.

entries: The sea flayer makes a tentacle attack.

entries: The sea flayer regenerates one tentacle, or regains 10 hit points.

action.name: Tentacles
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) psychic damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 12}) and must succeed on a {@dc 12} Intelligence saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of the mind flayer head's next turn.

action.name: Brain Bite
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5ft., one {@condition incapacitated} creature {@condition grappled} by the mind flayer head. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d8}) psychic damage.

action.name: Mind Blast (1/Short Rest)
entries: The mind flayer head magically emits psychic energy in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 12} Intelligence saving throw or take 14 ({@damage 4d6}) psychic damage and be {@condition stunned} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Creature of Legend
entries: The reef swarm is a unique creature of legend. Its attacks are magical and it is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form, or banish it to another Plane of Existence.

trait.name: Corrode Metal
entries: Any nonmagical weapon that hits the reef swarm corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to -5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition made of metal that hits the reef swarm is destroyed after dealing damage.

trait.name: Crushing Bodies
entries: The reef swarm is made up of thousands of large underwater creatures which constantly thrash about, their armored bodies crashing against each other in a cacophonous pandemonium. A creature or object that begins its turn in the reef swarm's space or enters there for the first time on it's turn suffers 7 ({@damage 2d6}) bludgeoning damage from the swarm's flailing mass.

trait.name: Dissolving Bites
entries: If the reef swarm hits a creature wearing armor made of metal or a vehicle with a melee weapon attack, after resolving damage, the target must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw.

On a failed save, if the creature is wearing nonmagical armor, that armor takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to the AC it offers. Armor reduced to an AC of 10 or a shield that drops to a +0 bonus is destroyed.
If the target is a vehicle, it's AC is reduced by 1 (minimum 10).

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: When the reef swarm fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Sea Scent
entries: The reef swarm can magically pinpoint the location of any metal within 5 miles of it, be it metal supports, objects, nails, weapons, or anything else.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The reef swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Large creature.

action.name: Dissolving Tendrils
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 10} to hit, reach 0 ft., up to three separate targets in the swarm's space. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage and 14 ({@damage 4d6}) acid damage, or 10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage, and 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

action.name: Binding Spittle {@recharge 5}
entries: The reef swarm exhales globules of sticky mucus in a 120-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each target in that line must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw. A target takes 35 ({@damage 10d6}) acid damage and is {@condition restrained} for 1 minute on a failed save, or takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition restrained} on a successful one. A {@condition restrained} target can use its action to make a {@dc 18} Strength (Athletics) check on its subsequent turns, freeing itself on a success.

legendary.name: Tendril Attack
entries: The reef swarm makes one melee weapon attack against a single target using its Dissolving Tendrils.

legendary.name: Sudden Surge (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The reef swarm moves up to its speed in a direction of its choice.

legendary.name: Thrash and Flail (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The reef swarm thrashes and flails around violently. Each creature within the swarm's space must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.
In addition, any Huge or smaller vehicles caught in the area have a 20 percent chance of capsizing.
If the vehicle is a ship and this attack would reduce it's AC to 10 or below, the ship springs {@dice 2d4} leaks in its hull and begins to sink.

entries: The reef swarm moves up to its speed in a direction of its choice.

legendary.name: Thrash and Flail (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The reef swarm thrashes and flails around violently. Each creature within the swarm's space must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw, taking 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.
In addition, any Huge or smaller vehicles caught in the area have a 20 percent chance of capsizing.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The endraleth can breathe both air and water.

trait.name: Creature of Legend
entries: The endraleth is a unique creature of legend.
Its attacks are magical and it has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: When the endraleth fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Mucous Cloud
entries: While underwater, the endraleth is surrounded by transformative mucus. A creature that touches the endraleth or that hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it must make a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature is diseased for {@dice 1d4} hours. The diseased creature can only breathe underwater.

trait.name: Probing Telepathy
entries: If a creature communicates telepathically with the endraleth, the endraleth learns the creature's greatest desires and fears if the endraleth can see the creature.

trait.name: Psionic Death Throes
entries: When the endraleth dies, it emits a psychic shriek, and each creature within 60 feet of it must make a {@dc 19} Intelligence saving throw, taking 56 ({@damage 16d6}) psychic damage and is {@condition stunned} until the end of their next turn, or half as much damage and not {@condition stunned} on a successful one.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The endraleth makes three tentacle attacks. It can replace one tentacle attack with a single use of Devour.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 13} to hit, reach 40 ft., one target.  {@h}20 ({@damage 3d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is Large or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 19}), and the endraleth can't use that tentacle to attack another target.
The endraleth has six tentacles.

action.name: Devour
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target {@condition grappled} by the endraleth. {@h}26 ({@damage 3d12 + 7}) bludgeoning damage. If this damage would reduce a creature to 0 hit points, the endraleth kills it by devouring the creature whole.

action.name: Aberrant Gaze {@recharge 5}
entries: The endraleth's eyes emit a magical, prismatic light in a 150-foot cone. Creatures who can see the light and start their turn in the area or move into the area for the first time on their turn must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition charmed} by the endraleth for as long as they remain in the cone's area of effect. A creature {@condition charmed} in this way is {@condition stunned} and can attempt this saving throw again at the start of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
The endraleth can maintain its Aberrant Gaze for up to 1 minute. While maintained in this way, the endraleth must concentrate on the gaze as if concentrating on a spell.
At the start of its subsequent turns, the endraleth decides which direction the cone faces by moving its body to match the new direction.

Enslave (3/day) The endraleth targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or be magically {@condition charmed} by the endraleth until the endraleth dies or until it is on a different plane of existence from the target. The {@condition charmed} target is under the endraleth's control and can't take reactions, and the endraleth and the target can communicate telepathically with each other over any distance.

Whenever the {@condition charmed} target takes damage, the target can repeat the saving throw. On a success, the effect ends. No more than once every 24 hours, the target can also repeat the saving throw when it is at least 1 mile away from the endraleth.

action.name: Psychic Drain
entries: One creature the endraleth can see or a creature {@condition charmed} by it takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) psychic damage, and, if the target is {@condition charmed} by it, the endraleth regains hit points equal to the damage the {@condition charmed} creature takes.

legendary.name: Tentacle Attack
entries: The endraleth makes a tentacle attack.

legendary.name: Psychic Drain (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The endraleth uses its psychic drain.

legendary.name: Shatter Psyche (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The endraleth targets one creature {@condition incapacitated} by its Aberrant Gaze and forces it to make a {@dc 19} Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 56 ({@damage 16d6}) psychic damage and becomes afflicted with short term madness (DMG, Chapter 8: Running the Game), which lasts for 1 minute.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The endraleth can breathe both air and water.

trait.name: Creature of Legend
entries: The endraleth is a unique creature of legend. Its attacks are magical and it has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: When the endraleth fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Mucous Cloud
entries: While underwater, the endraleth is surrounded by transformative mucus. A creature that touches the endraleth or that hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature is diseased for {@dice 1d4} hours. The diseased creature can only breathe underwater.

trait.name: Probing Telepathy
entries: If a creature communicates telepathically with the endraleth, the endraleth learns the creature's greatest desires and fears if the endraleth can see the creature.

trait.name: Psionic Death Throes
entries: When the endraleth dies, it emits a psychic shriek, and each creature within 60 feet of it must make a {@dc 17} Intelligence saving throw, taking 35 ({@damage 10d6}) psychic damage and is {@condition stunned} until the end of their next turn, or half as much damage and not {@condition stunned} on a successful one.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The endraleth makes three tentacle attacks. It can replace one tentacle attack with a single use of Devour.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 11} to hit, reach 40 ft., one target.  {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is Large or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}), and the endraleth can't use that tentacle to attack another target.
The endraleth has six tentacles.

action.name: Devour
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target {@condition grappled} by the endraleth. {@h}25 ({@damage 3d12 + 6}) bludgeoning damage. If this damage would reduce a creature to 0 hit points, the endraleth kills it by devouring the creature whole.

action.name: Aberrant Gaze {@recharge 5}
entries: The endraleth's eyes emit a magical, prismatic light in a 150-foot cone. Creatures who can see the light and start their turn in the area or move into the area for the first time on their turn must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition charmed} by the endraleth for as long as they remain in the cone's area of effect. A creature {@condition charmed} in this way is {@condition stunned} and can attempt this saving throw again at the start of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
The endraleth can maintain its Aberrant Gaze for up to 1 minute. While maintained in this way, the endraleth must concentrate on the gaze as if concentrating on a spell.
At the start of its subsequent turns, the endraleth decides which direction the cone faces by moving its body to match the new direction.

Enslave (1/day) The endraleth targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or be magically {@condition charmed} by the endraleth until the endraleth dies or until it is on a different plane of existence from the target. The {@condition charmed} target is under the endraleth's control and can't take reactions, and the endraleth and the target can communicate telepathically with each other over any distance.

Whenever the {@condition charmed} target takes damage, the target can repeat the saving throw. On a success, the effect ends. No more than once every 24 hours, the target can also repeat the saving throw when it is at least 1 mile away from the endraleth.

action.name: Psychic Drain
entries: One creature the endraleth can see or a creature {@condition charmed} by it takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) psychic damage, and, if the target is {@condition charmed} by it, the endraleth regains hit points equal to the damage the {@condition charmed} creature takes.

legendary.name: Tentacle Attack
entries: The endraleth makes a tentacle attack.

legendary.name: Psychic Drain (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The endraleth uses its psychic drain.

legendary.name: Shatter Psyche (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The endraleth targets one creature {@condition incapacitated} by its Aberrant Gaze and forces it to make a {@dc 17} Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 42 ({@damage 12d6}) psychic damage. If the target fails this saving throw by 5 or more, it also becomes afflicted with a short term madness (DMG, Chapter 8: Running the Game), which lasts for 1 minute.

trait.name: Abyssal Regeneration
entries: The fireworm regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If submerged in lava, set on fire, or in the Abyss, it recovers 20 hit points instead. If the fireworm takes radiant damage, this trait doesn't function until the end of its following turn.

trait.name: Replication
entries: If killed by a nonmagical weapon, the fireworm regenerates and returns to life with 1 hit point {@dice 1d3} hours after it was killed. If that weapon dealt slashing damage, the fireworm splits into two separate halves, and both halves regrow into new fireworms within {@dice 1d10} hours.

action.name: Burning Bite
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target.  {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage, and 5 ({@damage 1d8}) fire damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}).
Until this grapple ends, the fireworm can't use its burning bite on another target.

action.name: Leech
entries: The fireworm drains the life from one creature it has {@condition grappled}. The {@condition grappled} creature must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. It takes 17 ({@damage 5d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one, and the fireworm regains hit points equal to half the damage dealt.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The swarm can breathe both air and water.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a small creature. The swarm can't gain temporary hit points.

trait.name: Elemental Attunement
entries: When residing in one of the elemental planes of existence, the aqua vespid has resistance to one damage type associated with that Plane, as detailed below:
Plane of Fire: fire Plane of Water: acid Plane of Air: cold Plane of Earth: bludgeoning

trait.name: Planar Vulnerability
entries: When on a plane of existence other than an elemental plane, the swarm has a -2 penalty on saving throws made to avoid being banished, as per the {@spell banishment} spell.

action.name: Bloodthirsty Bites
entries: The swarm attacks one creature in its space. The target creature must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 17 ({@damage 5d4 + 5}) piercing damage and 25 ({@damage 10d4}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. It takes 10 ({@damage 3d4 + 3}) piercing damage and 15 ({@damage 6d4}) necrotic damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one if the aqua vespid swarm has half its hit points or fewer. If the target is a creature that isn't undead or a construct, the swarm regains hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The aqua vespid can breathe both air and water.

trait.name: Elemental Attunement
entries: When residing in one of the elemental planes of existence, the aqua vespid has resistance to one damage type associated with that plane, as detailed below:
Plane of Fire: fire Plane of Water: acid Plane of Air: cold Plane of Earth: bludgeoning

trait.name: Planar Vulnerability
entries: When on a plane of existence other than an elemental plane, the aqua vespid has a -2 penalty on saving throws made to avoid being banished, as per the {@spell banishment} spell.

action.name: Bloodthirsty Bite
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 3} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage, and 5 ({@damage 2d4}) necrotic damage.
If the target is a creature that isn't undead or a construct, the aqua vespid regains hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The atropos' innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

trait.name: Astral Body
entries: While in the Astral Plane, the atropos uses the statistics of its astral body form (see stat block below). Hit points, conditions, and other effects should be tracked separately for each form until the atropos body and soul are reunited. If the atropos' material body is killed while in the Astral Plane, the atropos remains trapped in its astral body form.

trait.name: Antimagic Infection
entries: When the atropos is inside a host, the host's material body is considered to be under the effects of the {@spell antimagic field} spell. These effects don't extend to the atropos; it can cast spells from within the body as normal.

trait.name: Binding Caster
entries: When the atropos is inside a host, any spell it casts originates from the host itself, and the atropos doesn't require line of sight to its intended target, provided the host creature can see it.

trait.name: Evasive Removal
entries: When an atropos is successfully removed from a host, the atropos can use its reaction to immediately bite the creature that removed it.

trait.name: Lasting Vengeance
entries: If the atropos dies, or if its astral form is slain while its body remains inside a host creature, the host must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. The creature takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) acid damage on a failed save and is {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute, or half as much damage and isn't {@condition poisoned} on a successful one. For the next minute, the target must make this saving throw again at the start of each of its turns, until the atropos' body is removed, or 1 minute has passed. If this damage would reduce a creature to 0 it points, it dies.

action.name: Bite
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage, and if the creature is Small or larger, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). Until this grapple ends, the atropos can't bite another target.

action.name: Burrow
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature the atropos is grappling. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage, and the atropos burrows into the target. The grapple ends, and the atropos uses the creature as a host. The atropos can't be targeted by any Attack, spell or other effect while it remains inside the host. The atropos can exit the host as a bonus action on its turn.

A creature also can attempt to remove the atropos by hand as an action on its turn. The creature must make on a {@dc 15} Wisdom (Medicine) check. On a successful check, the atropos is removed from the host. On a failure, the host takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) piercing damage, and the removal DC increases by 1, to a maximum of 18, should the atropos still be alive when this check fails.

action.name: Astral Jump (Only When Inside A Host)
entries: The host creature must make a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the atropos projects both it and the target's astral bodies into the Astral Plane, as per the {@spell astral projection} spell. An {@condition unconscious} target automatically fails this saving throw.
If the atropos' material body is removed from a host, both it and the host's astral bodies are instantly returned to the Material Plane, and this effect ends.

trait.name: Astral Mimicry
entries: The atropos' astral body has a number of temporary hit points equal to half the maximum hit points of its material body host, and can mimic one class feature the host has, such as a barbarian's Danger Sense, or a fighter's Extra Attack. The atropos can only mimic one feature at a time. It can change the mimicked featured as a bonus action on its turn.

trait.name: Sever the Cord
entries: If the atropos' astral body rolls a natural 20 on the attack roll when using its astral strike against a target with an astral cord, it severs the astral cord and the target dies.

If this creature was host to the atropos' material body, the atropos' astral body immediately returns to the Material Plane and its material body regains a number of hit points equal to the hosts remaining hit points before it died.

action.name: Astral Strike
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature.  {@h}14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) psychic damage. If the target is host to the atropos' material body, the target's material body takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage.

trait.name: Vampiric Skin
entries: Any creature that touches the blood lash with bare skin or thin gloves takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage, and the blood lash regains hit points equal to the damage dealt. If the blood lash dies, for the next 8 hours, if a creature would touch the blood lash with bare skin or thin gloves, that creature takes 1 necrotic damage and the blood lash returns to life with 1 hit point.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The blood lash fish uses its Dazzling Flash, then makes two attacks with its tail.

action.name: Tail
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage, and 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature that isn't undead or a construct, the blood lash regains hit points equal to half the necrotic damage dealt.

action.name: Dazzling Flash
entries: The blood lash magically emits a burst of dazzling light in a 15-foot cone. Creatures in the area that can see the blood lash must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the end of the blood lash's next turn.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The burrow worm can breathe both air and water.

action.name: Bite
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The burrow worm can breathe both air and water.

trait.name: Parasitic Injection
entries: Whenever the burrow worm hits with a bite attack against a creature it is grappling, it can choose to inject its victim with eggs. A creature infected with burrow worm eggs gains a level of {@condition exhaustion}, and can not have less than 1 level of {@condition exhaustion} for as long as they remain infected. When the infected creature takes a long rest, they must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the infected creature gains another level of {@condition exhaustion} which can not be removed for as long as they are infected.

After 5 days, the egg hatches, and a young burrow worm (see stat block on the previous page) can be seen wriggling around beneath the infected creature's skin near where they were bitten. A hatched worm can be removed with a blade and a {@dc 15} Wisdom (Medicine) check. If the worm is not removed, 9 days after the initial infection the worm bursts from the host, dealing 55 ({@damage 10d10}) necrotic damage to the infected creature and appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet. If this damage reduces the creature to 0 hit points, the creature dies.

action.name: Constrict
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, and if the target is Large or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}). Until this grapple ends, the creature is {@condition restrained}, and the burrow worm can't constrict another target.

action.name: Bite
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature currently latched onto by the burrow worm. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Disease-Riddled
entries: The greenjacket is immune to disease. If a creature consumes any part of the greenjacket's flesh, they become {@condition poisoned} for {@dice 1d4} days.

trait.name: Draw the Hive
entries: When the greenjacket dies, it draws the attention of 3 ({@dice 1d6}) greenjackets not already involved in the combat. These additional greenjackets arrive on initiative count 20 in {@dice 1d4 + 1} rounds. There is usually a total of 10 ({@dice 3d6}) additional greenjackets in the surrounding area that can be drawn in this way, not including those already present in the combat. If 10 or more greenjackets are killed in the same hour, there is a 50% chance for their deaths to attract a colossal greenjacket. The colossal greenjacket arrives on initiative count 20 on the following round, and is hostile to all nongreenjacket or deathjacket creatures.

action.name: Stinger
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or contract The Green Blight.

trait.name: Disease-Riddled
entries: The swarm is immune to disease. If a creature consumes any part of the swarm's flesh, they become {@condition poisoned} for {@dice 1d4} days.

trait.name: Draw the Hive
entries: When the swarm dies, there is a 50% chance for it to draw the attention of either 2 ({@dice 1d3}) additional deathjacket swarms, or a single colossal greenjacket. These additional creatures arrive on initiative count 20 in {@dice 1d4 + 1} rounds, but don't have the Draw The Hive feature.
Upon arriving, the deathjacket swarms or colossal greenjacket are hostile to all non-greenjacket or deathjacket creatures.

trait.name: Massed Targets
entries: When the swarm takes damage from an attack or spell that has an area of effect, such as fireball, and has more than half its hit points remaining, the attack or spell deals an additional 2 die of damage.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Small greenjacket. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

action.name: Stingers
entries: Three creatures in the swarm's space must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. A creature takes 22 ({@damage 4d6 + 8}) piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. The target instead takes 11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one if the swarm has half its hit points or fewer.
If a creature fails this saving throw by 5 or more, it contracts a random disease from the Greenjacket Diseases table.

trait.name: Bursting Spores
entries: When a creature within 5 feet of the greenjacket damages it with a weapon that deals piercing or slashing damage, that creature takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage, and must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw against disease. On a failed save, the target is afflicted with Retching Deathgrip. At the end of each of the target's turns, it must make another Constitution saving throw.

After failing three of these saving throws, the disease's effects last for the duration, and the creature stops making these saves. After succeeding on three of these saving throws, the creature recovers from the disease. Upon recovering, the target is immune to the Retching Deathgrip disease for the next 8 hours.

trait.name: Disease-Riddled
entries: The greenjacket is immune to disease. If a creature consumes any part of the greenjacket's flesh, they become {@condition poisoned} for {@dice 2d6} days.

trait.name: Draw the Hive
entries: When the greenjacket dies, its death attracts a deathjacket swarm. The deathjacket swarm arrives on initiative 20 in {@dice 1d4 + 1} rounds, and is hostile to all non-greenjacket or deathjacket creatures.

trait.name: Infested Host (3/Day)
entries: The greenjacket has a 50% chance to be host to a nest of parasights (described later in this chapter). When the greenjacket takes damage, it can spend its reaction to cause {@dice 1d4} parasites to appear in unoccupied spaces within 5 feet of it. The parasights are friendly to the greenjacket and its allies, but otherwise act independently. Roll initiative for the parasites as a group, which has its own turns.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The greenjacket makes two attacks with its claws and one attack with its stinger.

action.name: Claws
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Stinger
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d12 + 5}) piercing damage and 21 ({@damage 6d6}) poison damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or contract one of the following diseases detailed in the Greenjacket Diseases table, rolled for or chosen by the DM.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the corpse harvester can move up to its speed towards a hostile creature it can see.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The corpse harvester can breathe both air and water

trait.name: Hidden Hunter
entries: While buried in the ground, the corpse harvester appears as a mound of small bones. It is otherwise undetectable while it remains unmoving and buried.

trait.name: Surprise Attacker
entries: If the bone harvester hits a surprised creature with a melee weapon attack, that creature takes an additional 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bone harvester makes two pincer attacks.

action.name: Pincer
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 7} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage. A Medium or smaller creature hit by this attack is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}). Until this grapple ends the bone harvester can't use that pincer to attack another target. The corpse harvester has two pincers.

action.name: Bubbling Mucus {@recharge 5}
entries: Ranged weapon attack: {@hit 7} to hit, range 30 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 6d6 + 1}) acid damage. If the target is a creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained} for 1 minute. A {@condition restrained} creature can attempt this saving throw again at the end of its subsequent turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Adhesive Shell
entries: A creature that touches the shell of the corpse harvester becomes stuck to it. While stuck in this way, the creature is {@condition restrained}, shares the corpse harvester's space and moves with it as it moves. A stuck creature can use an action on its turn to make a {@dc 18} Strength (Athletics) check. On a success, the creature unsticks itself and can immediately move up to 10 feet in a direction of its choice.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the corpse harvester can move up to its speed towards a hostile creature it can see.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The corpse harvester can breathe both air and water

trait.name: Hidden Hunter
entries: While buried in the ground, the corpse harvester appears as a mound of bodies. It is otherwise undetectable while it remains unmoving and buried.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The corpse harvester makes two pincer attacks. If the corpse harvester is grappling a creature, it can replace one or both pincer attacks with a slam attacks, or use its Crush.

action.name: Pincer
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 11} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target.  {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) slashing damage. A Large or smaller creature hit by this attack is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 18}). Until this grapple ends the target is {@condition restrained}, and the corpse harvester can't use its pincer to attack another target. The corpse harvester has two pincers.

action.name: Slam
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 11} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage. If the corpse harvester is currently grappling a creature, the {@condition grappled} creature takes 22 ({@damage 3d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Crush
entries: One creature {@condition grappled} by the corpse harvester must make a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw. A target suffers 38 ({@damage 5d12 + 6}) piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

action.name: Bubbling Mucus {@recharge 5}
entries: Ranged weapon attack: {@hit 11} to hit, range 60 ft., one target, or two targets within 5 feet of each other. {@h}31 ({@damage 8d6 + 3}) acid damage. If the target is a creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained} for 1 minute. A {@condition restrained} creature can attempt this saving throw again at the end of its subsequent turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Surprise Attacker
entries: If the corpse harvester hits a surprised creature with a melee weapon attack, that creature takes an additional 11 ({@damage 2d10}) damage.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The death leech can breathe both air and water.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The death leech can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Death Leech makes two attacks with its bite, or one with its bite and one with its blood drain.

action.name: Bite
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage. A Medium or smaller creature hit by this attack is {@condition grappled}, but can still move as normal (escape {@dc 13}).
Until this grapple ends, the death leech shares the creature's space, moves with it when it moves, and can't attack another creature.

action.name: Blood Drain
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 4} to hit, reach 0 ft., one target {@condition grappled} by the death leech. {@h}10 ({@damage 4d4}) necrotic damage, and the death leech gains a number of temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt.

trait.name: Aquatic Dependency
entries: For each minute the deep crawler is not submerged underwater, it suffers 2 ({@damage 1d4}) necrotic damage.

trait.name: Shallows Ambusher
entries: The deep crawler can spend 1 minute burying itself in the sand and dirt. A {@dc 20} Wisdom (Perception) check reveals the deep crawler's location.

action.name: Bite
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Sonic Screech {@recharge 5}
entries: The deep crawler chooses one creature within 30 feet of it. The target creature must make a {@dc 13} Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the creature suffers 10 ({@damage 2d8}) psychic damage. If a creature rolls a 1 or a 2 on the die, it is also {@condition stunned} for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

trait.name: Aquatic Resilience
entries: The deep crawler can remain on dry land for 6 hours before needing to re submerge. For each minute thereafter that the deep crawler is not submerged underwater, it suffers 5 ({@damage 1d8}) necrotic damage.

trait.name: Pulsating Tendrils
entries: If a creature starts its turn within 30 feet of the deep crawler, it must make a {@dc 15} Intelligence saving throw.

On a failed save, the creature is {@condition stunned} until the start of its next turn. A creature that isn't surprised can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If it does so, it can't see the deep crawler until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If it looks at the deep crawler adult in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The deep crawler makes two electric tendril attacks and one bite attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 feet, one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d10 + 3}) piercing damage. A creature hit by this attack must succeed on a {@dc 15} Intelligence saving throw or take an additional 11 ({@damage 2d10}) psychic damage.

action.name: Electric Tendril
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 6} to hit, reach 15 feet, one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, plus 6 ({@damage 1d10}) lightning damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). While {@condition grappled} in this way, the target takes 6 ({@damage 1d10}) lightning damage at the start of its turn, and the deep crawler can't use that tendril on another target. The deep crawler has 2 tendrils.

action.name: Tendril Dance
entries: (1/ Day). The deep crawler's tendrils pulse with a vibrant display of changing colors. Creatures within 30 feet of the Deep Crawler not averting their gaze must succeed on a {@dc 15} Intelligence saving throw or be {@condition stunned} for 1 minute. A {@condition stunned} creature can repeat this saving throw at the end of its subsequent turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The deep crawler can breathe both air and water.

trait.name: Pulsating Tendrils
entries: If a creature starts its turn within 30 feet of the deep crawler, it must make a {@dc 17} Intelligence saving throw.

On a failed save, the creature is {@condition stunned} until the start of its next turn. A creature that isn't surprised can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If it does so, it can't see the deep crawler until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If it looks at the deep crawler in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The deep crawler makes 3 electric tendril attacks and one bite attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 feet, one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 3d10 + 7}) piercing damage. A creature hit by this bite must make a {@dc 17} Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save the creature suffers an additional 16 ({@damage 3d10}) psychic damage.

action.name: Electric Tendril
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 11} to hit., reach 20 feet, one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage and 11 ({@damage 2d10}) lightning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature it is also {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}). While {@condition grappled} in this way, the target takes 6 ({@damage 1d10}) lightning damage at the start of its turn, and the deep crawler can't use that tendril on another target. The deep crawler has 5 tendrils.

action.name: Tendril Dance
entries: (3/ Day). The deep crawler causes its tendrils to pulse with a vibrant display of changing colors. Any creature within 30 feet of the deep crawler that is not averting its gaze must make a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by the deep crawler for 1 minute. A {@condition charmed} creature can repeat this saving throw at the end of its subsequent turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Adhesive (Polymorphed Form Only)
entries: The mimic adheres to anything that touches it. A Large or smaller creature adhered to the mimic is also {@condition grappled} by it (escape {@dc 12}). Ability checks made to escape this grapple have disadvantage if the target is swimming or in chest high water.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The mimic can breathe air and water.

trait.name: False Appearance (Polymorphed Form Only)
entries: While the mimic remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary broken object or rotting corpse.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The mimic can use its action to polymorph into a broken object or corpse of a Medium or smaller creature, or back into its true, amorphous form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Savage Attacker
entries: Once per turn, if the mimic hits a target with a melee weapon attack, it can choose to reroll the attack's damage dice and use either total.

trait.name: Verbal Mimicry
entries: The mimic can magically mimic the voice of one creature it has heard speak for longer than ten minutes in the last month. It understands the language spoken by the creature, and can hold a basic conversation in the aforementioned language using simple words. A {@dc 13} Wisdom (Insight) check reveals the voice to be a mimicry, but doesn't reveal the mimic. The mimic can only remember one voice at a time. If it chooses to adopt a new voice, it forgets the old one.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The mimic makes two attacks with its pseudopods.

action.name: Pseudopods
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 feet, one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage. If the mimic is in its polymorphed form, the target is subjected to its Adhesive trait.

action.name: Bite
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 feet, one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Water Jet
entries: Ranged weapon attack: {@hit 5} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target.  {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage and 7 ({@damage 2d6}) cold damage.

monster.name: Drowned Spectre
monster.skill: one proficiency the creature had in life
languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Ethereal Sight:
entries: The drowned spectre can see 60 ft. into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane.

Incorporeal Movement: The drowned spectre can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Bound Haunting
entries: At sunset each day the drowned spectre appears in an unoccupied space within 120 feet of the location its living form died at. The drowned spectre vanishes at dawn each day, and can never move than 500 feet from its death location. If the drowned spectre is reduced to 0 hit points, it explodes into a fine green mist and vanishes, reappearing again with full hit points in {@dice 1d4} days. If the drowned spectre's true name is spoken to it, and proof is shown to it of its former life and business now finished, it vanishes and doesn't return.

action.name: Chilling Grasp
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 feet, one target.  {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) cold damage.

action.name: Life Leech (1/Day)
entries: The drowned spectre unleashes a torrent of wails out in a 30-foot cone. Creatures in the area must make a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw. The target takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one, and the drowned spectre regains hit points equal to the total damage dealt.

action.name: Drowning Visage
entries: Each non-undead creature within 30 ft. of the drowned spectre that can see it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. If the save fails by 5 or more, the target also begins to suffocate as its lungs magically fill with water. A {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effects on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to the drowned spectre's Drowning Visage for the next 24 hours.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The fata morgana's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The fata morgana can breathe air and water

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The fata morgana has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Trickster Form
entries: When a creature looks in the direction of the fata morgana it must make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature is {@condition charmed} by the fata morgana for 1 hour. The {@condition charmed} creature can't see or hear the fata morgana in any way. The target rationalizes any illogical outcomes from interacting with the fata morgana. For example, a target tripping over the fata morgana's tentacles comes up with some other explanation for its fall instead, such as tripping over some rigging, or being pushed over by a strong wind.  The target can use its action to examine these strange events with a {@dc 15} Intelligence (Investigation) check. If the check succeeds, the fata morgana is revealed to the target, and the effect ends. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the fata morgana's Trickster Form for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Tricks Of The Fey
entries: When casting the {@spell modify memory} spell, the fata morgana doesn't need to speak to the target in order for the spell to take effect.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The fata morgana makes two attacks with its tentacles.

action.name: Tentacles
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Rolling Movement
entries: The fossil golem can only move by rolling or dragging itself in a direction. It leaves a mound of upturned earth or debris in its wake, which counts as difficult terrain until cleared.
The fossil golem ignores any difficult terrain it creates in this way.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The fossil golem's attacks deal double damage to nonmagical structures and vehicles.

action.name: Slam
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 4d6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Rolling Bash
entries: The fossil golem rushes forward in a 30-foot-long, 5-foot-wide line. Any creature the fossil golem passes in the line must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or suffer 21 ({@damage 6d6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Quake {@recharge 5}
entries: The fossil golem emits a shockwave through the ground, which emanates out from it in a 60-foot wide, 10-footdeep cylinder. Creatures on the ground in the area must make a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 4d8} bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save, or takes half as much damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone} on a successful one. Creatures underground in the area have disadvantage on this saving throw. The area is then considered difficult terrain until cleared.

trait.name: Gibbering Hum
entries: If the gibberfish starts it turn on the surface or out of water it emits a howling chattering, audible out to 100 feet. Each creature that starts its turn within 20 feet of the gibberfish and can hear the chattering must succeed on a {@dc 10} Intelligence saving throw. On a failure, the creature is {@condition blinded} until the start of its next turn. If it fails this saving throw by 5 or more it is also {@condition paralyzed} for the duration.
