trait.name: Glistening Bioluminescence
entries: The gibberfish has disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks, and emits dim light out in a 10-foot radius.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: While out of water, the gibberfish can hold its breath for 10 minutes.

trait.name: Water Breather
entries: The gibberfish can only breathe underwater.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The gibberfish makes two attacks with its twin tongue.

action.name: Twin Tongue
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target.  {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Gibbering Hum
entries: If the swarm starts it turn on the surface or out of water it emits a howling chattering, audible out to 500 feet. Each creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the swarm and can hear the chattering must succeed on a {@dc 12} Intelligence saving throw.
On a failure, the creature is {@condition blinded} until the start of its next turn.
If it fails this saving throw by 5 or more it is also {@condition paralyzed} for the duration.

trait.name: Glistening Bioluminescence
entries: The swarm has disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks. It emits bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for a further 20 feet.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: While out of water, the swarm can hold its breath for 10 minutes.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a small fish. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

trait.name: Water Breather
entries: The swarm can only breathe underwater.

action.name: Bites
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 4} to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in the swarm's space. {@h}21 ({@damage 6d4 + 6}) piercing damage, or 14 ({@damage 4d4 + 4}) piercing damage if the swarm has half its hit points or fewer.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The infested avian has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Mind Hunter
entries: The infested avian can psionically sense the presence of creatures with an Intelligence of 6 or greater up to 1 mile away that aren't undead or constructs. It knows the general direction they're in but not their exact locations.

trait.name: Psionic Thralls
entries: If the infested avian's Drain Intellect reduces a creature's Intelligence score to 5 or less, the creature is {@condition charmed} by the infested avian until its Intelligence score is restored. While {@condition charmed} in this way, the target sees the infested avian as a close ally that must be protected at all costs, and is immune to the {@condition frightened} condition.

action.name: Tentacles
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature.  {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage and 3 ({@damage 1d6}) psychic damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 12}), and must succeed on a {@dc 12} Intelligence saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until this grapple ends.

action.name: Drain Intellect
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one {@condition stunned} creature {@condition grappled} by the infested avian. {@h}11 ({@damage 4d4 + 1}) piercing damage, and the target's Intelligence is reduced by 2 ({@dice 1d4}). The target's Intelligence score returns to normal at the end of its next long rest.

action.name: Psionic Pulse (1/Day)
entries: The infested avian releases a burst of psionic energy, which radiates out from it in a 10-foot radius sphere.  Creatures in the area must make a {@dc 12} Intelligence saving throw.  A creature takes 10 ({@damage 4d4}) psychic damage and is {@condition stunned} until the end of the infested avian's following turn on a failed save, or takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition stunned} on a successful one.

trait.name: Natural Ally
entries: Beasts of Challenge Rating 3 or less that start their turn within 30 feet of the inflated triodrodrilus are {@condition charmed} by it for 1 hour. The {@condition charmed} creature considers the inflated triodrodrilus a sworn ally that must be cared for and protected. This charm effect ends early if the triodrodrilus dies or is knocked {@condition unconscious}. When this charm ends, the affected creature is immune to this feature for 8 hours.

trait.name: Thermal Senses
entries: The inflated triodrodrilus can sense any creature within 5 miles of it with a body temperature greater than 30 C.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The inflated triodrodrilus makes two tendril attacks.

action.name: Tendril
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Deflating Burst {@recharge 5}
entries: The inflated triodrodrilus exhales gaseous water in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw. A creature takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save, or takes half as much damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone} on a successful one.  After resolving the attack, the inflated triodrodrilus deflates and loses its fly speed. It regains its flight speed when this feature recharges.

monster.name: Lonely Husk
monster.skill: one skill the creature knew before its transformation

trait.name: Cursed Form
entries: The lonely husk is immune to any effect that would alter its form while it remains afflicted with the Lonely Existence curse.

trait.name: Vicious Attachment
entries: At the end of its turn, the lonely husk deals 9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) piercing damage to a creature it is grappling. When a creature fails an ability check to remove the lonely husk, that creature takes 5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The lonely husk makes two attacks with its tentacles. If grappling a target, the lonely husk can replace a single tentacle attack with its bite.

action.name: Tentacles
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 4} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is Medium or smaller it is also {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, at the lonely husk can't use its tentacles on another target.

action.name: Bite
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Constrict
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 4} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature {@condition grappled} by the lonely husk. {@h}12 ({@damage 3d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.  If the target is more than 5 feet away from the lonely husk, it is pulled 5 feet closer to the lonely husk and must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or fall {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Absorbing Adaptation
entries: When the ooze would take cold, fire, lightning, bludgeoning, piercing or slashing damage, it can use its reaction to gain immunity to that damage type until the end of its following turn. When the ooze takes damage of a type it is immune to, it regains hit points equal to the damage dealt.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The ooze can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Natural Camouflage
entries: While in water, dim light or darkness the ooze gains a +10 bonus to Dexterity (Stealth) checks. If the ooze remains motionless for 1 hour on a rock of stone, it becomes indistinguishable from moss.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The ooze can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target.  {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage and 27 ({@damage 6d8}) acid damage.  Additionally, any nonmagical armor worn by the target is partly dissolved. The armor takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to the AC it offers. The armor is destroyed if the penalty reduces its AC to 10. If the target is wielding a shield, the ooze can choose to halve the damage it would have dealt to the target to cause the shield to suffer the cumulative -1 penalty instead.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The parasight can breathe both air and water.

trait.name: Aversion To Temperature
entries: If the host of a parasight is exposed to temperatures above 70C, or below freezing, it suffers 5 ({@damage 1d8}) fire or cold damage at the start of each of its turns.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the parasight is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Leaper
entries: The parasite has a standing leap of 15 feet. When it makes a melee weapon attack, it can leap up to 10 feet in a straight line towards its target before making the attack roll.

trait.name: Need to Feed
entries: The parasight dies if it spends more than 72 hours without a host.

trait.name: Parasitic Nature
entries: When infesting a host creature, the parasight has a +7 bonus to AC. It grants the host advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight, and darkvision out to a range of 120 feet. Each time the host creature completes a long rest, its Intelligence score is permanently reduced by 1 as the parasight devours part of its brain.  If the host creature's Intelligence is 10 or less, the parasight gains complete control of the host's body. The host creature is aware of its surroundings, but is otherwise helpless to the parasight's machinations.  If a the host creature's Intelligence score is reduced to 3 or less it dies, and the parasight ejects from the skull, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the corpse. An additional {@dice 2d6} parasights emerge from the corpse {@dice 1d4} hours later.

action.name: Leaping Latch
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature.  {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). If the target is Medium or larger, its speed isn't reduced.  Until this grapple ends, the parasight shares the target creature's space, and moves when it moves.

action.name: Infest
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature {@condition grappled} by the parasight. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage, and the target becomes host to the parasight, which burrows into the target through one of its eye sockets. It remains in the targets skull until it is removed, or the parasight ejects itself as a bonus action.

trait.name: Shell Shield
entries: The sand raptor can withdraw into or emerge from its shell as a bonus action. When inside its shell, it has a +3 bonus to AC, its movement speed increases to 60 feet, and it ignores difficult terrain.

action.name: Multiattack (Out of Shell Only)
entries: The sand raptor makes two attacks; one with its beak and one with its talons.

action.name: Beak
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Talons
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Rolling Charge (Inside Shell Only)
entries: The sand raptor moves up to half its speed in a straight line, moving through other creatures and objects in its path as it does so. Creatures the raptor collides with must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or take 24 ({@damage 6d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, and if they are Large or smaller they are knocked {@condition prone}. Objects automatically take this damage without being subject to a saving throw. If the creature or object is Huge or larger, the raptor's movement ends after colliding with it, before entering its space.

trait.name: Barbed Skin
entries: The sandwyrm can move across ceilings and walls using its barbed hide. Additionally, a creature {@condition grappled} by the sandwyrm takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage at the start of each of its turns or when it fails an ability check to escape the grapple.

trait.name: Grasping Maw Tendrils
entries: The sandwyrm has 6 writhing tendrils that cover its maw, which it can use to grapple up to two Large or smaller targets at a time. Each tendril has an AC of 20 and 30 hit points. If slashing damage reduces a tendril's hit points to 0 it severs, landing in an unoccupied space within 10 feet of the sandwyrm.

trait.name: Tunneler
entries: The sandwyrm can burrow through solid rock at half its burrow speed and leaves a 10-foot diameter tunnel in its wake.

trait.name: Limited Magic Resistance
entries: The sandwyrm has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects of 3rd-level or lower.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The sandwyrm makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its barbs.

action.name: Bite
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 3d10 + 9}) piercing damage, and if the target is Large or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} by the sandwyrm's mouth tendrils (escape {@dc 17}).

action.name: Barbs
entries: Ranged weapon attack: {@hit 12} to hit, range 60/120 ft., one target, or two targets within 5 feet of each other. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d10}) piercing damage.

action.name: Swallow
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target {@condition grappled} by the sandwyrm. {@h}25 ({@damage 3d10 + 9}) piercing damage.
The grapple ends on the target and it is swallowed by the sandwyrm.

The swallowed target is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside of the sandwyrm, and it takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the sandwyrm's turns. If the sandwyrm takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the sandwyrm must succeed on a {@dc 21} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures and objects it has swallowed within the past 6 hours, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the worm. If the sandwyrm dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 20 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Barbed Volley {@recharge 5}
entries: The sandwyrm unleashes a huge volley of spiked, cannonball sized barbs in a 60-foot cone.  Creatures in the area must succeed on a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw or take 55 ({@damage 10d10}) piercing damage. Creatures of size Large or smaller that fail this saving throw are also impaled. An impaled creature is {@condition restrained}, and takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage at the start of its turn. It can attempt to free itself from the barbs by making a {@dc 17} Strength (Athletics) check as an action on its turn.  Additionally, the area covered by the barbs is considered difficult terrain until cleared. Clearing the barbs from an area takes a creature 1 hour by hand.

trait.name: Anomalous Form
entries: The schlorvakk has {@dice 1d4 + 2} tendrils, {@dice 1d6 + 2} beaks, {@dice 1d4 + 1} stingers, {@dice 1d6} eye stalks, {@dice 1d6} arms, {@dice 1d4} legs and {@dice 1d4} tongues. When the schlorvakk takes 10 or more slashing damage from a single attack it loses one of appendage, determined by the DM. The schlorvakk regrows any lost appendages at the end of its next long rest.  When the schlorvakk remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from carrion.

trait.name: Devour, Adapt, Enlarge
entries: The schlorvakk can spend 1 minute pulling apart and devouring a deceased creature to regain all lost appendages and a number of hit points equal to the creature's total hit dice.  The creature must be of the same size or one size smaller than the schlorvakk in order to be consumed. Once the schlorvakk has consumed 5 creatures, its size increases from Medium to Large, or from Large to Huge. Each time the schlorvakk increases in size, it gains an additional {@dice 2d6 + 4} appendages chosen by the DM, and its maximum hit points increase by 30. If the schlorvakk is Large or Huge, it must consume at least one creature of equivalent size each day or revert back to its previous size, shedding {@dice 2d6 + 4} random appendages.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The schlorvakk is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The schlorvakk has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Silent Flight
entries: The schlorvakk has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made when flying.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The schlorvakk makes four attacks.

action.name: Beak
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage and 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the end of the schlorvakk's next turn.

action.name: Haymaker Punch
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end the schlorvakk's next turn.

action.name: High Kick
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target.  {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, and if the target is Medium or smaller, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Lick
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage and 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage. This attack deals an additional 3 ({@damage 1d6}) acid damage if the target doesn't have all its hit points.

action.name: Stinger
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target.  {@h}9 ({@damage 1d12 + 3}) piercing damage and 5 ({@damage 1d8}) poison damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or by {@condition paralyzed} until the end of the schlorvakk's next turn.

action.name: Tendril
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Eye Ray
entries: Ranged weapon attack: {@hit 5} to hit, range 60 ft., one target.  {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) force damage.

trait.name: Iron Grip
entries: A creature attempting to break free from the sea trident's grapple does so with disadvantage.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: While out of water, the sea trident can hold its breath for 1 hour.

trait.name: Underwater Camouflage
entries: The sea trident has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made while underwater.

trait.name: Water Breathing
entries: The sea trident can breathe only underwater.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The sea trident makes two attacks with its crushing grip.  If the sea trident is grappling a creature, it can replace any use of crushing grip with a bite.

action.name: Crushing Grip
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target.  {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). Until this grapple ends, the sea trident shares the target's space, moving with it whenever the target moves.  The target's speed is reduced to 10 feet, and the sea trident can't use its crushing grip on another target.

action.name: Bite
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 7} to hit, reach 0 ft., one target {@condition grappled} by the sea trident. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage and 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Venom Burst {@recharge 5}
entries: The sea trident exhales a burst of venomous hairs out in a 30-foot cone. Creatures in the area must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. A creature takes 28 ({@damage 8d6}) poison damage and is {@condition poisoned} on a failed save, or takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition poisoned} on a successful one. At the end of a {@condition poisoned} creature's turns, it must make a Constitution saving throw. After failing two of these saving throws, the creature becomes {@condition paralyzed} for 1 hour, and the creature stops making these saves. After succeeding on two of these saving throws, the creature recovers from the poison, and the effect ends for it.

trait.name: Fisherman's Fear
entries: The swarm deals double damage to structures and waterborne vehicles.

trait.name: Organic Thermal Detector
entries: The swarm knows the location of any Medium or larger warm-blooded creature or ship within 5 miles of it that has a temperature greater than 30C.

trait.name: Shredding Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature or object's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a small beast. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points. A target that begins its turn in the swarm's space or moves there for the first time on a turn suffers 7 ({@damage 2d6}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Water Breathing
entries: The swarm can only breathe underwater.

action.name: Shredding Strikes
entries: Each creature or object in the swarm's space must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw. A target takes 35 ({@damage 10d6}) slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.  A target instead takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) slashing damage on a failed save or half as much if the swarm has half its hit points or fewer.

trait.name: Constant Shrieks
entries: The swarm emits a constant, high pitched wailing, audible out to 120 feet. A creature that starts its turn within 60 feet of the swarm and can hear it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw. A creature takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) thunder damage and is {@condition deafened} for 1 minute on a failed save, or takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition deafened} on a successful one. If a creature fails this saving throw by 5 or more, it is also {@condition stunned} until the end of the swarm's next turn. A {@condition deafened} creature can attempt this saving throw again at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Large Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the flock can move through any opening large enough for a small beast. The swarm can't regain hit points during combat, or gain temporary hit points. If the swarm takes a long rest, it regains all its hit points as more shrieking steps join it.

action.name: Bites
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 5} to hit, reach 0 feet, one target in the swarm's space. {@h}27 ({@damage 10d4 + 2}) piercing damage, or 14 ({@damage 5d4 + 2}) piercing damage if the swarm has half its hit points or fewer.

action.name: Unified Shriek {@recharge 5}
entries: The swarm shrieks in unison, emitting a deafening wail audible out to 300 feet in a 60-foot cone.  Creatures that can hear the swarm and are caught in the area must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw. A creature takes 28 ({@damage 8d6}) thunder damage and is {@condition deafened} and {@condition blinded} for 1 minute on a failed save, or takes half as much damage and suffers no other effects on a successful one. If a creature fails this saving throw by 5 or more, it is knocked {@condition prone} and {@condition incapacitated} for the duration. An affected creature can attempt this saving throw again at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Bite
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 feet, one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shriek {@recharge 4}
entries: The shrieking step emits a high pitched wail, which is audible out to 60 feet. Creatures other than shrieking steps that can hear the noise must succeed on a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw or take 3 ({@damage 1d6}) thunder damage and be {@condition deafened} for 1 minute. If a creature fails this saving throw by 5 or more, it is also {@condition stunned} for the duration. An affected creature can attempt this saving throw again at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Monstrous Shrieks
entries: The shrieking king emits a constant, bellowing wail from its many mouths, audible out to 150 feet.  A creature that starts its turn within 60 feet of the shrieking king and can hear it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw. A creature takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage and is {@condition blinded} and {@condition deafened} for 1 minute on a failed save, or takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition blinded} or {@condition deafened} on a successful one.  If a creature fails this saving throw by 5 or more, it takes an additional 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage, and is {@condition incapacitated} for the duration. An affected creature can attempt this saving throw again at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Lumbering Mass
entries: The shrieking king can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the shrieking king can move through any opening large enough for a Large creature.

trait.name: The Many Eyed Horror
entries: The shrieking king has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Born of Magic and Terror
entries: The shrieking king has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects, and its attacks are magical.

trait.name: Lightning Absorption
entries: Whenever the shrieking king is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and regains a number of hit points equal to the lightning damage dealt.

trait.name: Lunar Vulnerability
entries: If the shrieking king is subjected to radiant damage originating from the {@spell moonbeam} spell or similar lunar related magic, the radiant damage is doubled, and the shrieking king doesn't regain its spent legendary actions on its following turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The shrieking king makes two slam attacks. If both attacks hit the same Medium or smaller target, the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}), and the shrieking king uses its Engulf on it.

action.name: Slam
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Engulf
entries: The shrieking king engulfs a Medium or smaller creature {@condition grappled} by it. The engulfed target is {@condition blinded}, {@condition restrained}, and unable to breathe, and it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw at the start of each of the king's turns or take 20 ({@damage 4d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage. If the shrieking king moves, the engulfed target moves with it. The shrieking king can have two creatures engulfed at a time.

action.name: Shriek of the King {@recharge 5}
entries: The shrieking king emits a monstrous, brain shattering screech in a 90-foot cone, audible out to 300 feet. Creatures caught in the area must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw, taking 56 ({@damage 16d6}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.  Creatures who are not within the cone but are within 15 feet of the shrieking king are also subject to this effect. Creatures that fail this saving throw by 5 or more are also knocked {@condition prone} and {@condition stunned} until the end of the shrieking king's following turn.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The shrieking king makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

legendary.name: Sudden Lurch
entries: The shrieking king moves up to half its movement speed.

legendary.name: Fast Strike
entries: The shrieking king makes a Slam attack.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The mind-eater can breathe both air and water.

trait.name: Puppetry
entries: While grappling a creature, the mind-eater directly controls it. It knows all of the creature's recent memories (up to 1 month), and is magically concealed from visual detection by nonmagical means. The controlled creature is awake and lucid during this puppetry, but is unable to act in any manner not dictated or chosen by the mind-eater.  A Wisdom (Insight) check contested by the mind-eater's Charisma (Deception) check reveals the puppet creature is acting strangely and not themselves.

trait.name: Sympathy
entries: While latched onto a creature the mind-eater can spend its bonus action to cause all damage it receives to instead apply to its to its host. This effect lasts until the start of the mind-eater's following turn.

action.name: Latch
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}).  While {@condition grappled}, the creature is subject to the mind-eater's Puppetry feature.

action.name: Devour The Mind (3/Day)
entries: The mind-eater magically consumes the brain functions of one creature it is currently grappling. The target must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw. It takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) necrotic damage and reduces its Constitution score by 2 ({@dice 1d4}) for 1 hour on a failed save, or takes half as much damage and no reduction to its Constitution score on a successful one. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, it dies, and this effects end for it.  If the target is brought back to life by means of the {@spell revivify} spell or similar magic, it can no longer feel pain, and the reduction to its Constitution score is permanent until cured by the {@spell greater restoration} spell or similar magic.

monster.name: Stalking Zuzu
languages: understands Abyssal and Infernal but can't speak.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The zuzu's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). The zuzu can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

trait.name: Rush of Talons
entries: If the zuzu uses its Wild Sprinter feature, the next weapon attack it hits with that round is a critical hit.

trait.name: Tight Grip
entries: When the zuzu hits a target with its talons, it can use its bonus action to attempt to grapple the target. If successful, it can't use its Wild Sprinter feature or its talons on another target until this grapple ends.

trait.name: Wild Sprinter (1/Short Rest)
entries: When the zuzu would move on its turn while on the ground, it can double its speed until the end of the turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The stalking zuzu makes three attacks; one with its talons, and two with its beak.

action.name: Beak
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage. If this damage would reduce a creature to 0 hit points, it dies and the zuzu steals its soul. While a creature's soul remains in the zuzu's possession, that creature can't be revived by anything short of the {@spell wish} spell. The zuzu can store up to 3 souls at a time. These souls are released when the zuzu dies, or if the zuzu chooses to regurgitate one as a bonus action.

action.name: Talons
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d10 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Psionic Scream {@recharge 5}
entries: The zuzu magically emits psychic energy in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 15} Intelligence saving throw or take 36 ({@damage 8d8}) psychic damage and be {@condition stunned} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The tide hopper's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). The tide hopper can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The tide hopper can breathe both air and water.

trait.name: Happy Traveller
entries: The tide hopper ignores difficult terrain.  Additionally, dragging a {@condition grappled} creature doesn't reduce the tide hopper's movement.

action.name: Bite
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) piercing damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 12}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the tide hopper can't bite another target.

action.name: Twin Tails
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 4} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target, or two targets within 5 feet of each other. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Aberrant Resistance
entries: The watchlin has advantage on saving throws against magic and other magical effects. Additionally, magic can't put it to sleep.

trait.name: Ever Watching
entries: The watchlin doesn't need to breathe or sleep.

trait.name: Monstrous Shapechanger
entries: The watchlin can use its action to consume the corpse of a Medium or Small humanoid and magically polymorph into a living version of it, or back into its true form. The only thing it can't perfectly recreate is the eyes, which instead shift between the eyes of previous victims at random. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The watchlin can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings or by clinging to the underside of a seafaring vessel without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The watchlin makes two attacks with its tentacles.

action.name: Tentacles
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the watchlin can't use its tentacles on another target.

action.name: Smother
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one Medium or smaller target {@condition grappled} by the watchlin. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, the grapple ends, and the watchlin attaches to the target by engulfing the target's head. The target is also {@condition blinded}, and unable to breath or speak while the watchlin is attached in this way. The watchlin has advantage on attack rolls against a creature it is attached to. The watchlin's speed becomes 0, it can't benefit from any bonus to its speed, and it moves with the target. A creature can attempt to detach the watchlin by using its action to make a {@dc 13} Strength check. On a success, the watchlin is detached, and can use its reaction to move up to half its movement without provoking opportunity attacks. On its turn, the watchlin can detach itself as a bonus action.

item.name: Deep Blade
entries: rare

entries.name: Adult Properties:
entries: Save DC 17, +2 to attack and damage rolls.

entries.name: School of Magic:
entries: Illusion

This rugged blade is crafted from the protruding spines of the deep dweller's grasping tendrils. While not overly sharp, the blade's serrated edge gives it a fearsome intimidating appearance. You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Additionally, this sword has 3 charges and regains {@dice 1d3} charges each night at the stroke of midnight.

When you hit a creature with this blade, you can expend 1 charge to force that creature to make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target's eyes are covered in an inky, magical darkness, and the target becomes {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. A {@condition blinded} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success

item.name: Deep Dweller Leather
entries: rare

entries.name: Adult Properties:
entries: Grants an additional +2 bonus to AC.

entries.name: School of Magic:
entries: Illusion
This thick leather armor settles on your body like a rubbery mass, protecting you from harm while remaining as light as a feather.
While you are in {@quickref Vision and Light||2} or darkness, you are {@condition invisible} to creatures that are more than 30 feet away from you.

item.name: Deep Dweller Shield
entries: uncommon

entries.name: Adult Properties:
entries: While holding this shield, you have a +1 bonus to AC. This bonus is in addition to the shield's normal bonus to AC.

entries.name: School of Magic:
entries: Illusion

Once per day, you can use your action to slam the shield into the ground and cast {@spell darkness} at 2nd level. The magical darkness remains for 1 minute or until dispelled. Quiet screams and distant cries of terror can be heard emanating from within the spell's radius.

This shield is made from wood covered in the thick leather hide of the deep dweller and is carried in one hand. Wielding a shield increases your Armor Class by 2. You can benefit from only one shield at a time.

item.name: Deep Fang Daggers
entries: rare (requires attunement)

entries.name: Adult Properties:
entries: Each dagger has a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls.

entries.name: School of Magic:
entries: Illusion
This pair of daggers are carved from the fangs of the legendary deep dweller. Each dagger is a single piece; beginning with a smooth, sinewy handle and ending in a razor-sharp point.

Each dagger deals an additional {@damage 1d4} psychic damage when you hit a creature with this magic weapon, or {@dice 1d6} additional psychic damage if you are wielding a deep fang dagger in each hand. Additionally, when you dual wield these daggers, they emit wistful echoes and shrieks when passing by each other. Any creature within 10 feet of you who can hear the shrieks has disadvantage on attack rolls against you unless they are immune to the {@condition frightened} condition.

entries.name: Adult Properties:
entries: Save DC 17

entries.name: School of Magic:
entries: Enchantment
This deadly vial contains a dark, thick poison that, when applied to an open wound or ingested, induces severe vomiting and hysteria.

As an action, you can throw the vial towards a point you can see within 20 feet of you. Each creature within 5 feet of that point must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. Alternatively, you can rub the poison directly into a creature's open wound by using your action to make a melee weapon attack against the target. On a successful hit, the target becomes {@condition poisoned}. A creature {@condition poisoned} by Deepblood Poison can't take reactions and must roll a {@dice d10} at the start of each of its turns to determine its behavior for that turn:

The {@condition poisoned} creature can make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw at the end of its subsequent turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. A target automatically succeeds on this saving throw if it has all of its hit points, but automatically fails this saving throw if it instead ingests the poison, such as by consuming {@condition poisoned} food or drink. A creature so {@condition poisoned} (by ingestion) can only recover by way of lesser restoration or similar magic.

rows: The target uses all its movement to run, screaming, in a random direction. To determine the direction, roll a d8 and assign a direction to each die face. The target doesn't take an action this turn.
The target doesn't move or take an action this turn, instead spending its turn vomiting black blood profusely.

The target uses its action to make a melee attack against a randomly determined creature within its reach, while rambling incoherently. If there is no creature within its reach, the creature instead targets its own features, such as nails, hands, hair or ears.
The target moves and acts normally.

entries.name: Adult Properties:
entries: Save DC 17, +2 bonus to attack rolls.

entries.name: School of Magic:
entries: Illusion

This barbed arrow is carved from the remains of the deep dweller's tendril spines. You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this piece of magic ammunition. Once it hits a target, the ammunition is no longer magical. Additionally, if you hit a creature with more than one of these arrows in the same turn, the target must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition blinded} for 1 minute as their eyes become infected with a magical darkness.
A {@condition blinded} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

entries.name: Adult Properties:
entries: Save DC 17, {=bonusWeapon} to attack and damage rolls.

entries.name: School of Magic:
entries: Illusion

This axe sports a fearsome and intimidating serrated head, forged from the spines of a deep dweller tentacle. You have a {=bonusWeapon} bonus to attack and damage rolls with this weapon, and it deals an additional {@damage 1d6} slashing damage on a successful hit. Additionally, the weapon has 3 charges. It regains {@dice 1d3} charges daily at dawn. When you hit a creature that doesn't have all its hit points with this weapon, you can expend 1 charge to force it to make a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target is {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. A {@condition blinded} target can attempt the saving throw again at the end of each of its following turns, ending the effect on a success.

entries.name: Adult Properties:
entries: Grants the interior crew immunity to psychic damage, instead of resistance.

entries.name: School of Magic:
entries: Abjuration

This upgrade coats a ship's hull in a jet-black coat of powdered deep dweller flesh. The hull and other components of the ship are immune to lightning damage. Crew inside the ship have resistance to psychic damage, and advantage on saving throws made to resist mind-altering spells and other magical effects.
This feature doesn't extend to crew in the crow's nest, or on deck, only to those inside the ship itself.

entries.name: Adult Properties:
entries: Heals {@dice 4d4 + 4} and {@dice 4d8 + 8} respectively.

entries.name: School of Magic:
entries: Evocation

This thick, clear gel can be applied to an open wound, forming a protective, binding seal over the wound that prevents blood loss and accelerates healing. A single vial contains three doses. As an action, one dose can be applied to the skin.

The creature that receives it regains {@dice 2d4 + 4} hit points. The gel is more effective at promoting recovery if a body is resting. If applied during a short rest, the creature instead regains {@dice 2d8 + 8} hit points.

If applied to a creature who is dying, the gel stabilizes the creature immediately, but they remain {@condition unconscious} until awoken by other stimuli. How many hit points the {@condition unconscious} creature regains depends on how long they are allowed to rest. If the creature awakens in less than an hour they get {@dice 2d4 + 4} hit points, whereas if it is an hour or more they awaken with {@dice 2d8 + 8} hit points instead.

entries.name: Adult Properties:
entries: Tape can be re-used once. Covers 10 x 10 ft.

entries.name: School of Magic:
entries: Enchantment

A small roll of thin, porous material, crafted from the suckers of a deep dweller tentacle. You can spend ten minutes to unravel the tape and bandage a {@condition poisoned}, {@condition petrified}, or diseased creature. The target creature's condition is slowly absorbed into the material over the course of {@dice 1d4} hours. Once absorbed, the tape is destroyed and can no longer be used, and the condition ends on that creature.
There is enough tape on the roll to cover a 5 ft x 5 ft area.

entries.name: Adult Properties:
entries: You can also cast the {@spell sending} spell without requiring components, however the potion's effect ends after the spell is cast.

entries.name: School of Magic:
entries: Enchantment

This potion glows with a dim, green hue when held towards the light. When poured, it has the consistency of water, but moves as a single, ooze-like entity. When you drink this potion, you gain advantage on Intelligence ability checks and Intelligence saving throws for 1 hour.
Additionally, for the duration you can cast the {@spell message} cantrip without requiring components.

item.name: Notched Dweller Whip
entries: (requires attunement)

entries.name: Adult Properties:
entries: +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls.

entries.name: School of Magic:
entries: Illusion
A whip, made from hardened leather and layered with hooked spines crafted from a deep dweller fang. The whip is black and rubbery in texture, and appears to twitch slightly when unsheathed.
You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls with this weapon, and it deals an additional {@damage 1d4} psychic damage on a hit.

As an action you can begin spinning the whip around you, and if you concentrate on the whip as if concentrating on a spell, it will continue spinning around you for the next minute even after you let go of it. For this duration the whip emits a haunting shriek that can be heard out to 100 feet, and the first time a hostile creature comes within 10 feet of you or starts its turn there, it takes {@damage 4d4} psychic damage.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again in this way again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Greater Properties:
entries: Duration increases from 1 hour to 8.

entries.name: School of Magic:
entries: Abjuration

This pale, sickly silver liquid glows when held in {@quickref Vision and Light||2||bright light}. When you drink this potion, it instantly cures the {@condition poisoned} condition. In addition, you become immune to poison damage and the {@condition poisoned} condition from all sources for 1 hour.

entries.name: Greater Properties:
entries: Damage increases to {@dice 2d6}, and you have advantage on Strength ({@skill Athletics}) checks made to grapple.

entries.name: School of Magic:
entries: Enchantment

When you drink this potion, you gain resistance to cold damage for 1 hour. For the duration, your breath crystallizes as you exhale, and the whites of your eyes become an icy blue. If you are grappling or being {@condition grappled} by a creature, that creature takes {@damage 1d6} cold damage at the start of each of your turns.

entries.name: Greater Properties:
entries: Has +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls.

entries.name: School of Magic:
entries: Evocation
This is a long, thin blowgun, carved from one of Umbrafang's teeth.
You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Additionally, you can use your action to cause the blowgun to emit a shrill, iconic whistle, audible out to 300 feet.

entries.name: Greater Properties:
entries: Save DC increases to 18.

entries.name: School of Magic:
entries: Transmutation

This stretch of thin, sinewy rope is crafted from one of Umbrafang's many tentacles. The rope is 60 feet long, weighs no more than 1 pound, and can withstand up to 500 pounds of stress or force. A creature bound in the rope can escape by making a DC 15 Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check, or by destroying the rope.

The rope has AC 20 and 20 hit points. When submerged in water, it becomes {@condition invisible}, is immune to all damage, and can withstand up to 1,500 pounds of stress or force instead. The rope regains 1 hit point every minute as long as it has 1 hit point. If the rope drops to 0 hit points, it is destroyed.

entries.name: Greater Properties:
entries: Grants +2 bonus to the attack roll.

entries.name: School of Magic:
entries: Evocation

This smooth arrowhead is carved from a tooth of Umbrafang, and retains a small fragment of its magical power. You have a +1 bonus to attack rolls made with this piece of magic ammunition, and deal an additional {@damage 1d6} piercing damage on a hit. Once it hits a target, the ammunition is no longer magical.

entries.name: Greater Properties:
entries: Swim speed increases to 50 feet.

entries.name: School of Magic:
entries: Abjuration

This thin leather garment is made from the skin of Umbrafang. It sits atop the shoulders and drifts gently to and fro as if suspended underwater. While you are wearing this mantle, you gain a swimming speed of 30 feet. Additionally, while the mantle is wet your movement is unaffected by {@quickref difficult terrain||3}, and spells and magical effects can't reduce your speed or cause you to be {@condition paralyzed} or {@condition restrained}. When not submerged in water, the mantle dries completely in 1 minute.

entries.name: Greater Properties:
entries: Escape DC increases to 18, and the whip can be used to grapple creatures of size Large or smaller.

entries.name: School of Magic:
entries: Transmutation

This is a tightly wound whip, created from one of Umbrafang's tentacles. The whip is a pale, translucent blue, and always feels damp to the touch. You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Additionally, it has a reach of 15 feet.

As an action you can activate the whip and make a melee attack against a creature within reach. On a hit, if the creature is medium or smaller, the whip wraps itself around the creature, grappling it for 1 minute. The {@condition grappled} target is {@condition restrained}, and can attempt to break free by making a DC 15 Strength ({@skill Athletics}) or Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check at the end of each of its turns. While grappling a creature, the whip can't be used to make attacks. Once this feature has been used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Umbra's Resilience
entries: rare (greater Umbrafang only)

entries.name: School of Magic:
entries: Abjuration

When you drink this potion, you gain resistance to nonmagical bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage for 1 hour. The potion has a thick, jelly like consistency, and tastes like raw fish when consumed.

entries.name: Greater Properties:
entries: Constitution save DC increases to 15.

entries.name: School of Magic:
entries: Transmutation
Dried and seasoned meat, carved from the body of Umbrafang, and packed tightly together in a bay leaf pouch. Eating a piece of this jerky counts as consuming a full day's worth of rations.

Each pack contains 3 pieces of Umbrafang jerky. The jerky remains edible for up to 40 days if re-packed in the bay leaf pouch. If exposed to water, the jerky becomes poisonous to any creature that consumes it.
A creature that eats a piece of {@condition poisoned} jerky must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour.

entries.name: Greater Properties:
entries: Grants +2 bonus, instead of +1.

entries.name: School of Magic:
entries: Enchantment

A sharpened dagger, carved from teeth harvested from Umbrafang and welded to a long metal chain. You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. It has the properties reach and two-handed, and can be used as a monk weapon.
Additionally, it can be used as a grappling hook. It grants you a +1 bonus to Strength (Athletic) and Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) checks made to climb or navigate vertical obstacles and terrain.

entries.name: Greater Properties:
entries: Constitution save DC increases to 15.

entries.name: School of Magic:
entries: Necromancy
This is a particularly potent toxin, taking from the poison glands of Umbrafang. An identify spell doesn't reveal this poison's true nature.
Instead, it looks, smells and tastes like a {@item Potion of Healing}.
If you drink this potion, you take {@damage 5d6} poison damage, and must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned}.

While {@condition poisoned} in this way, you are {@condition incapacitated}, and spend your turns hacking, coughing and retching. At the start of each of your turns, you take an additional {@damage 3d6} poison damage. You can attempt the saving throw again at the end of each of your turns. On a successful save, the poison damage you take on your subsequent turns decreases by {@dice 1d6}. The {@condition poisoned} condition ends when the damage it deals decreases to 0.

entries.name: Greater Properties:
entries: Grants a +1 bonus to AC.

entries.name: School of Magic:
entries: Abjuration
This sleek scaled leather is made from the hide of Umbrafang.
While you wear it, you have resistance to poison damage, and advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned}.
Additionally, the armor is completely waterproof, and dries within 1 minute when not submerged in water.

entries.name: Greater Properties:
entries: Piercing damage increases to {@dice 2d4}.

entries.name: School of Magic:
entries: Evocation
A glistening bone dart, created from Umbrafang's jagged maw. This dart deals an additional {@damage 1d4} piercing damage on a hit. Once it hits a target, the dart is no longer magical.
